column4: does anybody know which package the fuse kernel module is in?
are you sure? that seems like a lot of installing for something quite trivial? in addition, I don't see how it's relevant?
i just did a search for fuse.ko and that was the only result. you shouldn't have to install it manually as it comes by default with ubuntu-desktop
that's what I thought, but it refuses to enable it, saying module not found (for modprobe fuse)
which fs are you trying to use?
then just install that and use it. you shouldn't have to bother with the kernel module
i'm trying but apparently it does matter- i'm trying to use it to sync tomboy over ssh
do you have sshfs installed? what's the command you're using to mount?
i'm not- i'm doing it through the tomboy gui
this tomboy think looks like a load of fail
shame, it's a really useful program
anyway, what does tomboy say and what are you trying to do?
then when i click enable, it says failed
to be honest i think i'm going to leave it for the minute, i have actual work to do- i had hoped it would be a quick fix but i guess not!
dmesg | tail may be of help. so might running tomboy in the terminal
